title: While I like 1337 refference, Brutalizer seems flawed and over loaded limiting AD item build paths
body:
Reasoning behind this issue?
Let us say that there was an AD item costing around 800 to 900 gold that gave unique passive: 10% CDR and 15 AD building from only a {{item:1036}}. There would be a fair number of build concepts opened up with something like that.

Compare the 8 items that long sword builds into with the 12 that Amp tome builds into or the 17 that ruby crystal builds into.
And jsut for reference
8 for pick axe, 6 for blasting wand, 5 for giant's belt
4 for BF sword 6 for NLR

AD items with secondary stats seems to be lacking when compared to AP and health.

As it stands the only item you can build from a single {{item:1036}}  that you are likely to ever get is a {{item:1053}}  since no one gets {{item:3141}} 

So while I like the LEET reference of 1337 on Brutalizer it might be for the best if Brutalizer was divided into 2 different items One with CDR and the other with armor pen.

Just an observation. I don't expect anything done about this since a lot of people love Brutalizer but it is limiting the creation of other items from happening given that it is both the AD armor pen and CDR item.

Actaully many champs will build a Brutalizer and hold on to it for a while since ghostblade does not offer much more in the way of base stats.

They get use out of the armor pen, CDR and AD though making it a good all around good buy but then they often get things like tiamat, BotRK and LW for more damage.

Basically Brutalizer is a damage enhancer that just happens to also have another stat that many of these champs want in CDR. It is an item that is easy to sit on for 20 minutes with no real down side in doing so.
